title.narrative: Emerging Infectious Diseases Prevention, Preparedness and Response Project

description.narrative: The proposed project development objective is to strengthen selected national and provincial systems to pilot a multi-sectoral approach for reducing the risk of zoonotic and other emerging health threats.

condition.narrative: Annual Work PlansLA, Schedule 2, Section I.C.1, PAs, Schedule, Section I.B.1 : (a) The Borrower, through NHC, MARA and NFGA, andthe Project Implementing Entities: (i) prepare and furnish to the Bank by October 30 in each year, starting in 2020, a draft AnnualWork Plan for review and comment, summarizing the implementation progress of their Respective Part of the Project for the said year(or such other period covered by the said plan), including a summary of the activities not completed in said year and an actionplan for the completion thereof, as well as the activities for their Respective Part of the Project to be undertaken in thefollowing calendar year (or such other period covered by the plan), including the proposed annual budget for their Respective Partof the Project; (ii) taking into account the Bank's comments, finalize, adopt and furnish to the Bank by December 31 in each year,starting in 2020, the Annual Work Plan, in form and substance acceptable to the Bank; and (iii) thereafter ensure that: (A) theimplementation of their Respective Part of the Project during the following calendar year (or such other period covered by theplan) is carried out in accordance with the Annual Work Plan agreed with the Bank and in a manner acceptable to the Bank; and (B)unless the Bank otherwise agrees, all goods, works, services, Incremental Operating Costs and Training financed by the Loanproceeds are used exclusively for activities specified in the Annual Work Plan. The Borrower, through NHC, MARA and NFGA, and theProject Implementing Entities shall not amend, suspend, abrogate, or waive said Annual Work Plans or any provision thereof withoutthe prior written agreement of the Bank.(b) If any of NHC, MARA, NFGA or the respective Project Implementing Entity have notadopted and furnished to the Bank their respective Annual Work Plan in form and substance acceptable to the Bank, and if, bySeptember 30 in each year, starting in 2022, the Borrower, the Project Implementing Entities and the Bank have not agreed on areallocation and use of the Expected Annual Allocation for the respective Annual Work Plan that was not furnished to the Bank, in amanner consistent with the objectives of the Project, the Bank may take action pursuant to Section 7.03 (b) of the GeneralConditions with respect to all or a portion of such Expected Annual Allocation.

Environmental and Social StandardsLA, Schedule 2, Section I.D, PAs, Schedule, Section I.C: The Borrower, through NHC, MARA andNFGA, and the Project Implementing Entities shall: (a) ensure that their Respective Part of the Project is carried out inaccordance with the Environmental and Social Standards, in a manner acceptable to the Bank; (b) ensure that their Respective Partof the Project is implemented in accordance with the Environmental and Social Commitment Plan (“ESCP”) (c) ensure that all measuresnecessary are taken to collect, compile, and furnish to the Bank through regular reports, with the frequency specified in the ESCP,and promptly in a separate report or reports, if so requested by the Bank, information on the status of compliance with the ESCPand the environmental and social instruments referred to therein, all such reports in form and substance acceptable to the Bank,setting out, inter alia: (i) the status of implementation of the ESCP; (ii) conditions, if any, which interfere or threaten tointerfere with the implementation of the ESCP; and (iii) corrective and preventive measures taken or required to be taken toaddress such conditions; (d) ensure that the Bank is promptly notified of any incident or accident related to or having an impacton the Project which has, or is likely to have, a significant adverse effect on the environment, the affected communities, thepublic or workers, including incidents of community exposure to communicable diseases, in accordance with the ESCP, theenvironmental and social instruments referenced therein and the Environmental and Social Standards; (e) establish, publicize,maintain and operate an accessible grievance mechanism, to receive and facilitate resolution of concerns and grievances ofProject-affected people, and take all measures necessary and appropriate to resolve, or facilitate the resolution of, such concernsand grievances, in a manner acceptable to the Bank; and (f) ensure that all bidding documents and contracts for civil works undertheir Respective Part of the Project include the obligation of contractors, and subcontractors and supervising entities to: (i)comply with the relevant aspects of the ESCP and the environmental and social instruments referred to therein; and (ii) adopt andenforce codes of conduct that should be provided to and signed by all workers, detailing measures to address environmental, social,health and safety risks, and the risks of sexual exploitation and abuse, sexual harassment and violence against children, all asapplicable to such civil works commissioned or carried out pursuant to said contracts.

Institutional Arrangements (Hainan)PA, Schedule, Section I.A.1: For the purpose of carrying out its Respective Part of Project,the Project Implementing Entity shall maintain, and cause to be maintained, the following entities with composition, powers,functions, staffing, facilities and other resources acceptable to the Bank:(a) the Provincial Project Management Officeresponsible for the coordination, planning, reporting, management, including management of the fiduciary, environmental and socialaspects, implementation, and monitoring and evaluation of activities under the Project Implementing Entity's Respective Part of theProject and coordination with the Borrower and the Bank; (b) an implementation unit within each of the provincial departmentssupporting the Provincial Project Management Office in the implementation of the Project Implementing Entity's Respective Part ofthe Project, including preparation of the Annual Work Plans and Multi-Sectoral Plans, semi-annual progress and financial reports,and day-to-day implementation of the activities within their jurisdiction under the Project Implementing Entity's Respective Partof the Project, including management of the fiduciary, environmental and social aspects(c) a technical expert group responsiblefor providing technical support to enhance quality in the design of activities under and facilitate implementation of the ProjectImplementing Entity's Respective Part of the Project; and(d) any other implementation structures at the provincial, municipal orcounty level, as may be agreed from time to time with the Bank and set out in the Project Operations Manual.

Institutional Arrangements (Jiangxi)PA, Schedule, Section I.A.1: For the purpose of carrying out its Respective Part of Project,the Project Implementing Entity shall maintain, and cause to be maintained, the following entities with composition, powers,functions, staffing, facilities and other resources acceptable to the Bank:(a) the Provincial Project Management Officeresponsible for the coordination, planning, reporting, management, including management of the fiduciary, environmental and socialaspects, implementation, and monitoring and evaluation of its respective activities, including the preparation of the Annual WorkPlans and the Multi-Sectoral Plans; and the Provincial Project Management Office within its Provincial Health Commissionresponsible for overall coordination, consolidated planning, reporting, and monitoring and evaluation of the activities under theProject Implementing Entity's Respective Part of the Project and coordination with the Borrower and the Bank; (b) a technicalexpert group responsible for providing technical support to enhance quality in the design of activities under and facilitateimplementation of the Project Implementing Entity's Respective Part of the Project; and(c) any other implementation structures atthe provincial, municipal or county level, as may be agreed from time to time with the Bank and set out in the Project OperationsManual.

Institutional Arrangements (national level)Loan Agreement (LA), Schedule 2, Section I.B1. For the purpose of carrying out theProject, the Borrower shall maintain, and cause to be maintained the National Project Steering Group with composition, powers andfunctions acceptable to the Bank responsible for providing overall direction, coordination, policy and institutional guidance onProject implementation among NHC, MARA, NFGA, NDRC, MOF and the Project Implementing Entities and facilitating the coordination ofpolicy dialogue with other relevant agencies.2. For the purpose of carrying out its Respective Part of the Project, the Borrower,through NHC, MARA and NFGA, shall maintain, and cause to be maintained, the following entities with composition, powers, functions,staffing, facilities and other resources acceptable to the Bank:(a) the National Project Management Offices responsible foroverall coordination, reporting, management, including management of environmental and social aspects, and monitoring andevaluation of, and adoption of the Annual Work Plans for their respective activities under the Borrower's Respective Part of theProject, and coordination with the Project Implementing Entities and any other local authorities under arrangements set forth inthe Project Operations Manual; (b) the National Project Implementation Units responsible for supporting the respective NationalProject Management Office in the implementation of the Borrower's Respective Part of the Project, including preparation of theAnnual Work Plans, semi-annual progress and financial reports, and day-to-day implementation of the activities under the Borrower'sRespective Part of the Project, including procurement and financial management; and(c) a technical expert group responsible forproviding technical support to enhance quality in the design of Project activities and facilitate Project implementation at thenational and provincial level.

Mid-term ReviewLA, Schedule 2, Section II.2, PAs, Schedule, Section II.2 : the Borrower, through NHC, MARA and NFGA, and theProject Implementing Entities shall prepare, under terms of reference acceptable to the Bank, and furnish to the Bank no later thanApril 30, 2023, a consolidated mid-term review report for their Respective Part of the Project, summarizing the results of themonitoring and evaluation activities carried out from the inception of their Respective Part of the Project, and setting out themeasures recommended to ensure the efficient completion of their Respective Part of the Project and to further the objectivesthereof.

Project Operations ManualLA, Schedule 2, Section I.C.2, PAs, Schedule, Section I.B.2: The Borrower, through NHC, MARA and NFGA,and the Project Implementing Entities shall apply throughout the implementation of their Respective Part of the Project, theProject Operations Manual in a timely and efficient manner acceptable to the Bank. The Borrower, through NHC, MARA and NFGA, andthe Project Implementing Entities shall not amend, suspend, or waive said Project Operations Manual or any provision or schedulethereof, without the prior written agreement of the Bank.
